column4: Gabon oil workers' strike halts Vaalco terminal output - union
column5: DAKAR, March 27 (Reuters) - Production at a Gabonese petroleum terminal operated by VAALCO Energy Inc has been halted by a strike launched on Sunday over employees’ annual leave, the oil workers’ union said on Wednesday.
column6: “The 14,000 barrels produced per day by this operator before the strike have been at zero since yesterday morning,” the union, called ONEP, said in a statement, adding that the planned five-day strike would be extended if its demands were not met.
column7: VAALCO was not immediately available for comment. (Reporting by Aaron Ross; Writing by Sofia Christensen; Editing by Jan Harvey)
